historical:
Legislative History of Laws

For history of Law 19-137, see notes under § 1-1061.01.

Uniform Law:

This section is based on § 12 of the Uniform Military and Overseas Voters Act. See Vol. 13, Part II, Uniform Laws Annotated, Master Edition or ULA Database on Westlaw.

DC CODE § 1-1061.12

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: A valid military-overseas ballot cast in accordance with § 1-1061.10 must be counted if it is delivered within 10 days after the election to the address that the Board has specified.

If, at the time of completing a military-overseas ballot and balloting materials, the voter has declared under penalty of perjury that the ballot was timely submitted, the ballot may not be rejected on the basis that it has a late postmark, an unreadable postmark, or no postmark.

subchapter.text: Accommodations for Military and Overseas Voters.
